definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
house/room/CL:間|间[jian1]/branch of an extended family/classifier for family members (or concubines)

sentences.english: M father is putting the car in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 我父親正在把車放進車房。

sentences.english: I have been in the BMW Sauber garage and could not believe what I saw.
sentences.chinese: 我去了寶馬車隊的車房，簡直不敢相信自己的眼睛。

sentences.english: Additionally room of a car rents, can make goods warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 還有一個車房誠意出租，可作堆棧。

sentences.english: After the storm stopped, Mr. B inspected the garage for damage.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雨後，B先生檢查車房的損害。

sentences.english: I plan to clean out my garage.
They built a new room above [over] the garage.
sentences.chinese: 他們在車房上加蓋了一個新房間。

sentences.english: They flush off their garage floor every day.
My father is putting the car in the garage.
sentences.chinese: 我父親正把車放進車房。

sentences.english: A room located at the rear.
Garages across the outlook exhibition will attract more crowd.
sentences.chinese: 車房聯動必將吸引更多的觀展人羣。

sentences.english: Give them away, have a garage sale, or throw them away.
sentences.chinese: 把它們送給人，來個車房大拍賣，或者丟掉吧。

sentences.english: He carefully backed his car up into the garage.
sentences.chinese: 他小心翼翼地將車倒進車房。

sentences.english: A. How much would it cost build one extra room beside the garage?
sentences.chinese: 耍在車房邊建一間房會要多少錢？

sentences.english: And I have a dragon living in my garage, would you like to see it?
sentences.chinese: 我家車房還住着一條龍呢，你想看看嗎？

definition: spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
you can net sparrows at the door (idiom); completely deserted
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
to bind a person's upper body, with arms tied behind the back and rope looped around the neck/to truss up
